name: Fieldwork: Payroll Post-Termination Audit
description: Audit workflow to identify and validate payments made to employees after their termination date.

data.label: HR Termination Data Extraction
data.description: Extract the list of employees terminated during the audit period, including their termination dates and employee IDs.
data.instructions:
1. Access HR Information System (HRIS).
2. Filter for all employees with a termination status or termination date within the specified audit period.
3. Export data including: Employee ID, Full Name, Termination Date, and Reason for Termination.

data.label: Payroll Data Extraction
data.description: Extract the full payroll register for the audit period.
data.instructions:
1. Access the Payroll System.
2. Export the payroll register for the audit period.
3. Ensure the data includes: Employee ID, Pay Period End Date, Gross Pay, Net Pay, and Pay Type (Regular, Bonus, Severance, etc.).

data.label: Data Joining & Reconciliation
data.description: Join HR termination data with the payroll register using Employee ID.
data.instructions:
1. Use a join operation (e.g., SQL JOIN or Excel VLOOKUP/Power Query) to combine the two datasets on the Employee ID field.
2. Retain only records for employees found in the termination list.

data.label: Identify Post-Termination Payments
data.description: Filter the joined dataset to identify payments where the pay period end date is after the termination date.
data.instructions:
1. Apply a filter: [Pay Period End Date] > [Termination Date].
2. Calculate the number of days between termination and payment.
3. Flag all records that meet this criteria for further review.

data.label: Validation of Payments
data.description: Validate flagged payments against valid reasons like severance or final vacation payouts.
data.instructions:
1. Review the 'Pay Type' or 'Reason for Termination' for flagged records.
2. Determine if the payment is a standard final payout (e.g., accrued leave, severance) or a regular payroll cycle payment that should have stopped.
3. Document valid justifications for each payment.

data.label: Exception Investigation
data.description: Perform a deep-dive investigation into any unexplained or suspicious payments.
data.instructions:
1. Contact payroll and HR administrators for missing documentation.
2. Review system logs for manual overrides or changes to termination dates.
3. Identify root causes for any overpayments (e.g., processing delays, system errors).

data.label: Audit Reporting
data.description: Compile findings into an audit report with recommendations for process improvements.
data.instructions:
1. Summarize total number and value of post-termination overpayments.
2. Detail root causes identified.
3. Recommend controls to prevent future occurrences (e.g., automated triggers between HRIS and Payroll).
